Title: Breaking Free from the Need for Male Approval in Professional Growth
Description:
Women in the workplace often face an unspoken pressure to seek validation from male colleagues, leaders, or industry gatekeepers. This need for approval can shape career decisions, limit ambition, and reinforce self-doubt. But what happens when we stop waiting for permission and start defining success on our own terms?_x000D_
_x000D_
This session is about breaking free from external validation and stepping into authentic, self-driven leadership. We‚Äôll explore how societal conditioning influences professional growth, why women are often held to different standards of approval, and how to redefine confidence and authority without the need for male endorsement._x000D_
_x000D_
Attendees will walk away with:_x000D_
_x000D_
Practical strategies to shift from external validation to self-trust in decision-making._x000D_
How to navigate bias and double standards without shrinking or over-explaining._x000D_
A mindset framework to own your expertise, advocate for yourself, and advance confidently._x000D_
Tools to build influence and credibility without conforming to outdated workplace norms.
TagLine: PhD Researcher, University of bristol
Bio: Jennifer is a PhD candidate in Innovation and Entrepreneurship at the University of Bristol. She is dedicated to understanding the factors that contribute to the success of women in technology entrepreneurship, with the ultimate goal of shaping better policies and practices for the transformation of developing economies.

Title: AI + A11Y = Surfa il web senza tavola...e senza mani!
Description:
E se al posto di usare il mouse, potessimo navigare le nostre pagine facendo l'occhiolino o con il movimento della testa? Pu√≤ una Chrome Extension cambiare il modo di usare il proprio browser?_x000D_
_x000D_
Grazie all'AI ed ai modelli "on the edge", √® possibile provare nuove frontiere di navigazione del web, utili magari a chi non ha la possibilit√† di usare le mani come vorrebbe!_x000D_
Un esperimento utile, navigando con le sole espressioni facciali, per comprendere un nuovo modo di concepire l'uso dei dispositivi rendendo ancora pi√π accessibile ci√≤ che non lo era._x000D_
_x000D_
La strada √® ancora lunga...ma perlomeno √® tracciata!
Are you a Google employee or GDE?: Yes, and I will be applying with Google's speaker program
TagLine: CEO @ Devmy - Google Developer Expert, Microsoft MVP, Google Certified Developer & AWS UG Lead
Bio:
Francesco √® Google Developer Expert, Microsoft MVP, Google Certified Developer ed AWS User Group CT Lead, ed √® da sempre orientato allo sviluppo web (frontend e backend) ed al team management._x000D_
_x000D_
Lavora prima come dipendente e poi come freelance, sino a cogliere una nuova sfida fondando Devmy insieme al suo socio (ed amico) Andrea Ortis._x000D_
_x000D_
Ama collezionare fumetti e statue di Batman, suonare la batteria, girare in moto, giocare a padel e passare tanto tempo con la sua amatissima famiglia.

Title: Come racconter√≤ Kubernetes a mia figlia
Description:
"C'era una volta Bino, un elefantino che vendeva piume. E Bino voleva esplorare il mondo, e si avventur√≤ per mare assieme a Ual, una balena che gli insegn√≤ a stare su una zattera. Ma Bino voleva incontrare tanti altri animali, e conoscere il mondo, e poter essere veloce ed efficiente per vendere quante pi√π piume possibile, fino a quando non incontr√≤ una grande nave piena di promesse e magie._x000D_
Kubernetes √® un sistema complesso e per nulla scontato. Risulta quasi impossibile spiegarne il funzionamento interno ai non addetti ai lavori, ma le favole ci permettono di usare la fantasia per trasformare concetti solitamente complessi in qualcosa di magico. In questo talk vi racconter√≤ meccanismi dell'orchestrazione dei container cos√¨ come intendo farlo con mia figlia tra qualche anno, sfruttando la magia delle favole."
Are you a Google employee or GDE?: Yes, and I will be applying with Google's speaker program
TagLine: GDE Cloud | Mia-Platform Expert | Senior Enterprise Architect @ Adesso | Community Manager @ GDG Pescara
Bio: I have been working in the IT industry for over 15 years. I currently hold the role of Senior Enterprise Architect in Adesso. I am a Google Developer Expert on GCP and a Google Cloud Innovator Champion on the topic of modern architecture. I manage GDG Pescara together with other developers, I love sharing my knowledge and trying to do it in a fun way.

Title: Flutter and Game Development: Where to Begin?
Description:
What is Flutter? Can you learn this framework by building a video game from scratch? Or, as a Flutter mobile developer, can you leverage your skills to create cross-platform games?_x000D_
_x000D_
In this introductory talk, we‚Äôll explore Flutter - Google‚Äôs powerful open-source framework - from a different perspective. We‚Äôll discuss the challenges you might face and the first steps to take when stepping into the magical world of game creation with Flutter.
TagLine: GDG Firenze Organizer, Software Developer @ Alten
Bio:
Mirko didn't speak in binary or think in hexadecimal from birth._x000D_
He always enjoyed tinkering with gadgets, but it wasn't until his twenties that he wrote his first line of code. _x000D_
His interest in new technologies led him to the Google Developer Group (GDG) in Florence._x000D_
Eclectic and curious, he constantly works on personal projects, learns about new cultures, and travels the world._x000D_
He loves meeting people and discovering their stories._x000D_
Now, he transforms designs into apps using Flutter.

Title: Your app at a Glance: App Widgets in Compose
Description:
Widgets have been a part of Android since its beginning, but their diffusion has often been kept back by a complex development process. _x000D_
That has changed with Jetpack Glance, a modern framework powered by Jetpack Compose that significantly simplifies widget creation._x000D_
_x000D_
In this talk, we'll journey through widgets, understanding what they are, what the common use cases are and how they works under the hood. _x000D_
_x000D_
We'll also dive deep into Jetpack Glance, exploring its features and benefits.  But we won't stop at theory ‚Äì we'll build a widget for an existing app, addressing real-world issues often overlooked in basic documentation.
TagLine: Senior Android Developer @ Twinkly
Bio: Fabio is an Android lover even before being an Android Developer, he studied in Pisa and now lives in Padua working as Senior Android Developer for Twinkly. ‚Ä®Former Flutter developer, in his spare time helps the Google Developer Group Venezia organising events.

Title: The Feedback Loop: Building a Culture of Growth and Improvement
Description:
Effective feedback is the cornerstone of personal and team growth, yet delivering it constructively and receiving it openly can be challenging. Whether you're a team member, manager, or technical leader, mastering the art of empathetic feedback fosters trust, drives progress, and empowers teams to thrive._x000D_
_x000D_
In this talk, we‚Äôll uncover the core principles of effective feedback, emphasizing clarity, empathy, and actionable impact. We‚Äôll explore how to navigate common pitfalls, strike the right balance between praise and critique, and adapt your approach to different personalities and situations.
TagLine: Tech lead @ Bending Spoons
Bio: Aldo is a passionate T-shaped engineer fueled by curiosity and a zest for challenges. Naturally positive-minded, he loves learning new things and trying out new technologies. He enjoys mentoring and advocates for honest feedback. Living the dream in Tuscany, thanks to remote work.

Title: Imparare la cybersecurity catturando bandiere
Description: In questo talk vedremo cosa √® una competizione "Capture the Flag" (CTF), come usarle per imparare la security e l'informatica in generale, come la community Italiana si √® sviluppata negli ultimi 5 anni e quanto possa essere importante per costruire dell'esperienza lavorativa
TagLine: Security Engineer @ Doyensec
Bio:
Aleandro started his career in cyber-security during the last years of High School through CTF competitions playing in University of Salento and University of Pisa teams. He is now a full-time Security Engineer in a small international consultant firm._x000D_
He also loves to build stuff both in the cyber and in the physical space

Title: Storybook: l' Atomic Design oltre il wormhole üå™Ô∏è
Description:
Progettare interfacce utilizzando componenti modulari e riutilizzabili non √® sempre facile e intuitivo. ü§Ø_x000D_
Con Storybook, il viaggio nell'Atomic Design entra in una nuova dimensione, permettendoci di oltrepassare il wormhole del caos._x000D_
In questo talk, esploreremo come Storybook permetta di realizzare, adattare e documentare ogni singolo componente, offrendoci uno spazio dinamico per sviluppare e testare i componenti in modo isolato. Scopriremo come Storybook migliori la collaborazione tra le diverse parti del team, integrandosi anche con tool di progettazione e prototipazione grafica come Figma. Join with us! üöÄ
TagLine: Full Stack Developer presso TD Group Italia S.r.l.
Bio:
Laureata in matematica presso l'Universit√† di Pisa._x000D_
Sviluppo di applicazioni a microservizi in Java, GoLang e utilizzo di typescript, HTML, CSS per applicazioni web front-end con particolare attenzione alla progettazione grafica.

Title: unknown
Description: unknown
TagLine: TD Group Italia srl, Chief Technologist & Cloud Architect
Bio: Strong professional skilled in Microservices Architecture and Event Driven Architecture (EDA) with Docker, Rest services, Golang, Angular, Vue, React MongoDB & relational databases, Quarkus, Spring family products and Apache Kafka for asynchronous communication. Container orchestration with Docker Swarm and Kubernetes.

Title: Introduzione al Quantum Computing
Description:
Hai mai sentito parlare di Quantum Computing? Negli ultimi anni l'interesse per questo argomento √® cresciuto notevolmente, ma cosa c'√® davvero dietro? Che vantaggi pu√≤ portarci? E quando potremo finalmente usarlo?_x000D_
In questo talk scopriremo insieme questo mondo misterioso rispondendo a queste e tante altre domande nel frattempo!
TagLine: GDG Lead @ GDG Torino, Quantum Software Engineer @ Intesa Sanpaolo
Bio:
Since high school he has followed his passion for information technology. He decides to leave for Turin for a more stimulating environment, gains experience in consultancy and joins the GDG Turin where he develops a passion for talking about technology._x000D_
This passion finally leads him to throw himself into the world of innovative technologies by becoming a Quantum Software Engineer.

Title: What happens to your privacy when data are moved on cloud?
Description:
Nowadays we heard often people that talk about privacy. Services, platform and so on explicitly specify what they can do with your data but what if you want not to allow them to read it?_x000D_
_x000D_
This talk will give a different overview about privacy by considering the case where we want to store data on an external server (such as Amazon, Azure, etc,) but allowing it to learn nothing about the data itself. We will also see pro and cons of the solutions that can be used to achieve this kind of privacy.
TagLine: Ph.D. student @ University of Pisa | Lead @ GDG and WTM Pisa | WTM Ambassador
Bio: Hi! I'm a Ph.D. student at the computer science department of the University of Pisa.

Title: Overlay and Arazzo: From API Definitions to API Experiences
Description:
Do you feel your OpenAPI specifications are static and inflexible? Let's meet Overlay and Arazzo, two new specifications from the OpenAPI Initiative._x000D_
Overlay provides a new way to tailor your existing OpenAPI specifications to different audiences or environments, without altering the original source. Arazzo, on the other hand, helps you document complex API interactions, making it easier for developers to understand and implement multi-step processes._x000D_
This session will show you how to use these specifications to enhance developer onboarding, streamline API governance, and drive greater adoption of your APIs.
TagLine: Senior Software Engineer @ Red Hat
Bio: Gloria Ciavarrini received her PhD in Computer Engineering from the University of Pisa. Her main research interests included network-aware mobile applications and IP geolocation. She worked for 4 years in a FinTech company focusing on the implementation of scenarios for algorithmic surveillance of electronic trading. Gloria works at Red Hat as a Senior Software Engineer, actively contributing to various open-source projects. Currently, her focus is on the RHDH Orchestrator project._x000D_

Title: WordPress come Headless CMS: Sfruttarlo al Meglio con Angular
Description: WordPress √® il CMS pi√π utilizzato al mondo, ma il suo approccio tradizionale pu√≤ avere limiti in termini di performance e flessibilit√†. In questo talk, esploreremo come trasformarlo in un CMS headless, utilizzandolo solo come backend e integrandolo con un frontend moderno in Angular. Analizzeremo i vantaggi di questa architettura, come migliorare la scalabilit√†, ottimizzare le prestazioni e rendere il sito pi√π dinamico e reattivo. Vedremo anche best practice, strumenti e casi d‚Äôuso reali per adottare al meglio questo approccio.
TagLine: organizer @WordPress Meetup Pisa, PM @Net7
Bio: Chiara Aiola, laureata in Informatica Umanistica a Pisa, lavora nel  mondo del web dal 2010. Full stack developer, negli anni si √® specializzata nello sviluppo di soluzioni tecnologiche per il settore delle Digital Humanities e nella gestione dei progetti di questo ambito disciplinare. Dal 2024 √® co-organizer del WordPress Meetup Pisa, che con un incontro al mese riunisce tutti gli appassionati del CMS WordPress e non solo.

Title: Pixel and Particles: Generative Art meets Quantum Computing
Description: Since the 60s, computers have been used to create art in what is known as "Generative Art". In this talk we will be exploring how an emerging technology such as quantum computing can be applied to generative art and we will "play" with the randomness.
TagLine: GDG Roma
Bio:
Juna has always been curious about technology and when she discovered BASIC on C64, she decided to be a programmer._x000D_
What started just as a passion, quickly began a continuous formation path and a career in IT: she spends her time experimenting and in tech communities.

Title: Il ruolo della Gen-AI nella data science geospaziale
Description:
Le analisi geospaziali ormai godono di una storia ultra-decennale. La comunit√† dei data scientist che opera in questo settore ha attraversato tutte le rivoluzioni degli ultimi anni: dagli stravolgimenti dell'open-source al cambiamento dei paradigmi dei big-data, machine learning e blockchain. Anche la Gen-AI sta portando nuovi stravolgimenti sul fronte della geo-spatial data science._x000D_
Ripercorreremo in questo talk i passaggi storici e le nuove frontiere dei sistemi per analizzare dati provenienti da vari settori come Earth Observation, Remote Sensing e UAV.
TagLine: Engineer
Bio: Geospatial expert, data scientist - PhD student.

Title: A journey through the making of a new mobile app feature: from the idea to the customer
Description: In this presentation, we will go through the several steps needed to get from the initial design vision to the final mobile product on the market, using a feature we added recently as case study. We will look at the various challenges to be faced, such as platform-specific UI/UX guidelines, accessibility and consistent branding UI elements. Finally, we will provide an overview of the processes and technologies used to refine the design and ensure the quality of our products.
TagLine: Mobile app developer @ Garmin Italy Technologies SRL
Bio: As a computer engineering graduate, I pursued further studies to earn a Master's degree in Bioinformatics and Digital Health Engineering, blending my passion for technology with healthcare.  I currently work as a mobile developer, with a focus on Android software development.

Title: unknown
Description: unknown
TagLine: Mobile app developer @ Garmin Italy Technologies SRL
Bio: Passionate about IT since I was a kid, I begun programming in middle school and focused on mobile apps during high school. Graduated in Computer Science in 2021 and currently studying Artificial Intelligence at University of Pisa.

Title: Problemi NP-hard e come affrontarli
Description:
Molti problemi di interesse pratico rientrano nella famosa classe dei problemi NP-completi: si tratta di problemi difficili da risolvere, per i quali si conoscono solo algoritmi lenti, con un costo in tempo esponenziale._x000D_
Cosa possiamo fare, allora, quando ci troviamo di fronte a problemi di questo tipo?_x000D_
Partendo dal caso specifico della sintesi logica delle funzioni booleane, mirata alla progettazione di circuiti integrati ottimizzati secondo criteri quali l'area occupata, il tempo di risposta, o la potenza assorbita, questo intervento si propone di descrivere due approcci per affrontare in pratica i problemi difficili: la ricerca di "strutture regolari" all'interno dei dati da elaborare e la possibilit√† di sfruttare la tolleranza agli errori di alcune applicazioni.
TagLine: Dipartimento di Informatica, Universit√† di Pisa
Bio: Anna Bernasconi ha conseguito la laurea in Fisica presso l'Universit√† di Pavia nel 1992 e il dottorato in Informatica presso l'Universit√† di Pisa nel 1998. Attualmente √® Professore Associato nel Dipartimento di Informatica dell'Universit√† di Pisa, dove insegna corsi fondamentali come Algoritmi, Crittografia e Calcolo Quantistico. I suoi interessi di ricerca includono algoritmi e complessit√†, complessit√† delle funzioni booleane e sintesi logica per tecnologie emergenti.

Title: La Musica Del Malware
Description:
Ciao CVEs, miei vecchi amici, sono venuto a occuparmi di nuovo di voi perch√© una backdoor si insinua silenziosamente... Ops, scusate, stavamo cantando a squarciagola._x000D_
√à una cosa che continuiamo a fare ogni volta che una nuova vulnerabilit√† irrompe nella nostra routine quotidiana. Ultimamente √® successo sempre pi√π spesso a causa delle dipendenze del nostro software._x000D_
Log4J, avete detto? Oh, beh, non dimentichiamoci di XZUtils! Li chiamano attacchi alla catena di distribuzione. Abbiamo iniziato ad affrontarli a ritmo di SLSA (leggi ‚Äúsalsa‚Äù), ma poi abbiamo notato che potevamo fare di pi√π. Molto di pi√π! E abbiamo trasformato i nostri binari malevoli in... beh, in forme d'onda. E abbiamo iniziato a farli dondolare!_x000D_
Leggendo questi binari come se fossero normali forme d'onda e analizzandoli con un po' di matematica (Cepstum, serie di Fourier, ecc.) abbiamo creato un modello che mira a rilevare se una dipendenza √® dannosa. E anche di classificarla in base al tipo di malware. Affascinante, vero? Il suono del malware...
TagLine: Machine Learning Engineer @ Cy4Gate | Organizer @ GDG Pescara | Co-Founder @ Python Pescara
Bio: I graduated in Computer Engineering from the University of L'Aquila, with a strong passion for research, particularly in Machine Learning and Evolutionary Computation. I currently work as a Machine Learning Engineer in the IT sector, focusing on security and defense. My enthusiasm for learning and academia led me to the world of Dev Talks, where I share insights and foster discussions that push the boundaries of technology and innovation.

Title: unknown
Description: unknown
TagLine: GDE Cloud | Mia-Platform Expert | Senior Enterprise Architect @ Adesso | Community Manager @ GDG Pescara
Bio: I have been working in the IT industry for over 15 years. I currently hold the role of Senior Enterprise Architect in Adesso. I am a Google Developer Expert on GCP and a Google Cloud Innovator Champion on the topic of modern architecture. I manage GDG Pescara together with other developers, I love sharing my knowledge and trying to do it in a fun way.

Title: Crafting Digital Twins with an Actor Model in Rust
Description: Digital Twins represent a powerful paradigm for modelling complex IoT systems, yet practical implementations often fall short of theoretical promises. This talk cuts through the hype by demonstrating a robust approach based on an Actor Model pattern implemented in Rust, bridging the gap between conceptual frameworks and pragmatic engineering. Concurrency fundamentals, message-driven design patterns, and real-world use cases illustrate how Rust‚Äôs safety and performance guarantees enable maintainable, production-ready Digital Twin solutions.
TagLine: CTO @ Nextworks
Bio: Gianluca Insolvibile is co-founder and Managing Director at Nextworks. Strongly passionate in CompSci and technology at large, he has been writing software for nearly 40 years. Throughout this long journey, he dealt with game development, networking architectures and protocols, digital A/V encoding and transport, Linux kernel programming, IoT and cloud architectures. He currently leads the products and technology strategy in Nextworks, while occasionally writing software "for fun and profit".

Title: How to give your first Talk without freaking out
Description: Public speaking can be intimidating: where do we start from? How to find the right topic? How to put together a nice presentation? Will the audience ask me questions? In this talk I will provide first hand tips I learned the hard way on how to go from zero to give your first public talk with confidence._x000D_
TagLine: Senior Principal Software Engineer at Red Hat
Bio: Federico works remotely for Red Hat, contributing to network features of the OpenShift container platform. He contributed to a variety of networking and kubernetes related projects, and lately he has been maintaining and leading the MetalLB project, the Kubernetes load balancer implementation for bare metal. Beyond that, he is an active opensource supporter with contributions to various projects, Firefox for Android and Athens, the go dependency proxy among the others._x000D_

Title: Beats in the Browser - Coding Music with JavaScript
Description:
Javascript is extremely versatile. We use it to build frontend, backend, desktop and mobile apps. But did you know you can even create music with it ?!_x000D_
_x000D_
In this talk, Rowdy will show you how easy and fun it is to code your own music with the Web Audio API. As a bonus, he will throw in the Web MIDI API and Web Bluetooth API to really get the party started. Let‚Äôs turn up the bass!
Are you a Google employee or GDE?: Yes, and I will be applying with Google's speaker program
TagLine: Front-End Focused Senior DevOps Engineer
Bio: Rowdy Rabouw is a Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies with over 25 years of experience in HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Currently, he works as a Front-End-Focused Senior DevOps Engineer on Vue, Node and NestJS projects, paying special attention to usability and accessibility. Rowdy loves his electronic drum kit and dabbles in creating music on his laptop.

Title: Sailing the Waters using UI/UX Reinforced by Security
Description:
Everyone! You will always remember this day as the day that changed your perspective on security and UI/UX. Today, we set sail to discover the hidden treasures of these two islands. How many times don‚Äôt you hear that they are as different as day and night? But what if I told you they need each other, like a pirate ship and its sails! _x000D_
_x000D_
Remember, every great voyage begins with a single step. So, hoist the sails and set forth on an adventure of discovery. Together, we'll uncover the secrets that will make your designs not just functional, but extraordinary. Join Mike in this deep dive into the intersection of security and user interaction/experience, where we‚Äôll unearth strategies that ensure your applications are both safe and user-friendly. This is a golden treasure trove filled with knowledge! _x000D_
_x000D_
Not all treasure is silver and gold, my companions! But this session is a treasure you don‚Äôt want to miss!
TagLine: DevSecOps Expert @ Scyon
Bio:
My career has taken me through a diverse journey, spanning roles that include developer, business analyst, manager, and now thriving in security. Throughout this journey, my passion for technology has remained a constant driving force._x000D_
_x000D_
I approach my work with a focus on prioritizing people first, followed by processes, and then technology to enhance these efforts. This philosophy ensures that technological changes are seamlessly integrated and readily embraced by our teams and organizations.

Title: Service Design e accessibilit√† per i siti Web
Description: In questo intervento, rivolto a programmatori, verranno introdotti i concetti di Service Design e di accessibilit√† applicati ai siti Web. Per farlo parleremo di tubi dell'acqua (calda e fredda) e rubinetti, pentole per scolare la pasta e di bias (come il survivorship bias) per capire, con esempi "lontani" dall'ambito informatico, in quali tranelli potrebbe cadere un programmatore se ragiona da "tecnologo". Dopo un'introduzione dedicata al Service Design vedremo com'√® nato l'HTML e perch√© era (ora non pi√π!) tollerabile scrivere qualsiasi cosa (anche sbagliata) dentro un sito Web. Cercheremo di capire come mai il legislatore da pi√π di 20 anni (2004) abbia imposto l'accessibilit√† come requisito per i siti Web della pubblica amministrazione e come questa non sia pi√π una feature tra le tante desiderate ma diventa norma di legge, anche per tutti i siti commerciali, a partire da giugno 2025. Verr√† fatto cenno ad alcuni requisiti delle norme tecniche (WCAG) e ad alcuni semplici esempi di pagine non accessibili. La conoscenza, anche di base, di HTML √® gradita ma non √® strettamente necessaria per poter comprendere i concetti esposti.
TagLine: Docente di informatica nella scuola secondaria di secondo grado
Bio:
Ha conseguito la laurea in Scienze dell‚ÄôInformazione e la laurea specialistica in Informatica presso l‚ÄôUniversit√† di Udine. Dopo una lunga esperienza come analista programmatore Java EE e project manager, dal 2012 √® docente di Informatica._x000D_
Ha pubblicato numerosi articoli sulle principali riviste di Informatica ed √® autore di libri sulla programmazione e le tecnologie informatiche, tra cui alcuni manuali per la scuola secondaria superiore, editi da Zanichelli.

Title: Personalizzare l'IA per il Diritto: Addestrare Modelli su Dataset Legali
Description:
L‚Äôintelligenza artificiale pu√≤ essere adattata per compiti specifici tramite il fine-tuning di modelli pre-addestrati, trasformandoli in strumenti altamente specializzati. In questo talk presenter√≤ un progetto pratico basato su GPT-2, personalizzato per comprendere e generare testi giuridici, con un focus sull‚Äôinterpretazione del Codice Civile e Penale e sulla creazione automatizzata di querele. Il progetto sfrutta tecnologie open source per ottimizzare un modello di linguaggio gi√† esistente, rendendolo capace di rispondere a domande legali e generare documenti strutturati con un linguaggio formale e contestualizzato._x000D_
Durante l‚Äôintervento illustrer√≤ il workflow seguito, suddiviso in tre fasi principali. La prima riguarda la preparazione del dataset, che prevede l‚Äôestrazione dei testi normativi tramite web scraping e parsing, seguita dalla pulizia e tokenizzazione del testo con NLTK e Hugging Face Tokenizers, per garantire un‚Äôelaborazione efficace del linguaggio giuridico. La seconda fase si concentra sul fine-tuning di GPT-2, eseguito con PyTorch e TensorFlow per adattare il modello al dominio legale. Verranno ottimizzati iperparametri chiave come batch size, learning rate ed epoche, applicando tecniche di early stopping e gradient accumulation per migliorare le prestazioni su hardware limitato. Infine, nella terza fase, verr√† presentata l‚Äôinterfaccia web, sviluppata con Flask, che consente agli utenti di inserire domande giuridiche o descrivere un caso, ricevendo in risposta un‚Äôanalisi legale dettagliata o una bozza di querela generata automaticamente dal modello._x000D_
Il talk si concluder√† con una demo live, dimostrando come la personalizzazione di GPT-2 possa trasformare un modello generico in uno strumento avanzato per il settore giuridico. L'obiettivo √® mostrare come sia possibile adattare un LLM alle esigenze specifiche di qualsiasi organizzazione o settore.
TagLine: STUDENT @ ITIS VALLAURI VELLETRI | ASSOCIATED @ UNIDEA
Bio: Daniele Mario Areddu, studente dell‚Äôultimo anno di un istituto informatico e freelance, si occupa di sviluppo web e coltiva passioni e progetti legati all‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale. Da sempre interessato all‚Äôinformatica, partecipa a workshop e conferenze per approfondire le sue competenze e restare aggiornato sulle ultime novit√† del settore

Title: Extending Kubernetes: Building torproxy for Anonymous Container Communication
Description:
torproxy is an open source Kubernetes controller written in Go to enable tor utilities in your k8s cluster. _x000D_
We will go through the implementation of a generic controller, taking as example the torproxy._x000D_
The audience will learn more about writing kubernetes controllers, know more about tor network, Go language patterns
TagLine: Software Engineer @ Civo
Bio: Former student representative at the department of computer science in Pisa, I work most of my time with Golang and Kubernetes technologies, open source supporter, working at Civo. Currently I'm also working on an application called AllInMap

Title: Form inclusivi: l'importanza dei dettagli nascosti
Description:
I form sono spesso la porta d'ingresso ai servizi online. Come possiamo renderli pi√π inclusivi per gli utenti?_x000D_
Progettare e sviluppare un form inclusivo richiede una serie di considerazioni da fare nelle varie fasi del processo di realizzazione, che spesso vengono ignorate o date per scontate._x000D_
Scopriamo insieme come ridefinire un form e renderlo pi√π inclusivo.
TagLine: UX/UI Designer & Frontend Developer - WTM Ambassador
Bio:
Passionate about technology and design. The background in both fields led her to become a ux/ui designer and Frontend developer and become the point of contact of those worlds._x000D_
She likes organizing meetups with GDG Turin and share her knowledge.

Title: Boost your LLM-based application with a RAG system
Description:
Unlock the true potential of your Large Language Model (LLM) applications with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), a groundbreaking approach that blends advanced information retrieval with AI text generation. This session dives into how RAG transforms LLM capabilities, enhancing the reliability of generated responses by drawing on a rich base of external knowledge._x000D_
_x000D_
Discover why RAG is so captivating; it transcends traditional LLM limitations, minimizing inaccuracies and greatly reducing the occurrence of "hallucinations"‚Äîwhere LLMs generate plausible yet incorrect information. You will be equipped to construct your own RAG system using an LLM orchestrator through hands-on examples. Learn the inner workings by comparing popular frameworks like Haystack, Langchain, and LlamaIndex, each offering unique benefits and features for implementing a robust RAG architecture._x000D_
_x000D_
By the end of this session, you'll master the practical skills needed to design and implement a high-performance RAG system tailored to your specific needs, boosting the effectiveness of your LLM-based applications and truly maximizing their potential.
TagLine: AIKnowYou
Bio: Tommaso ha una formazione da fisico sperimentale che lo ha portato a fare esperienze di ricerca al CERN di Ginevra e al FermiLab di Chicago. Nel 2021 ha conseguito un dottorato in Data Science presso la Scuola Normale Superiore. Attualmente, lavora come data scientist per AIKnowYou e si occupa di prodotti software integrati con l'AI conversazionale nell'ambito del customer care.

Title: Verso una logistica intelligente: AI e Apprendimento Federato per ottimizzare processi logistici
Description:
L‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale sta trasformando il settore logistico, migliorando l‚Äôefficienza operativa e riducendo i costi. In questo talk esploreremo come le moderne tecniche di machine learning possano essere applicate all‚Äôottimizzazione logistica, focalizzandoci su un caso d‚Äôuso concreto: la predizione delle parti di ricambio per interventi di manutenzione e riparazione di elettrodomestici._x000D_
Esamineremo diverse strategie per la raccomandazione delle parti di ricambio ai tecnici, partendo da un primo approccio basato su Case-Based Reasoning e Natural Language Processing. Vedremo poi come l‚Äôintegrazione del Deep Learning abbia migliorato significativamente l‚Äôaccuratezza della predizione, riducendo il numero di visite necessarie per completare una riparazione._x000D_
Successivamente introdurremo il Federated Learning, un paradigma proposto da Google che consente di addestrare modelli predittivi pi√π efficaci in modo distribuito, permettendo a pi√π aziende operanti nello stesso settore di collaborare senza condividere dati sensibili. Discuteremo come abbiamo applicato questa tecnologia per migliorare ulteriormente la predizione dei ricambi, ottenendo modelli con migliori capacit√† di generalizzazione e benefici concreti in scenari reali._x000D_
Concluderemo offrendo una breve panoramica sulle attivit√† del Laboratorio IT2PAO, il laboratorio di ricerca congiunto tra l‚ÄôUniversit√† di Pisa e LogObject, dove stiamo esplorando ulteriori applicazioni dell‚ÄôAI per l‚Äôottimizzazione dei processi logistici e oltre._x000D_
Questo talk fornir√† una visione chiara sulle sfide e opportunit√† dell‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale nel mondo della logistica, con un focus sulle tecnologie pi√π recenti e sulle loro implicazioni pratiche._x000D_
TagLine: Machine Learning And Data Engineer @ LogObject AG
Bio: Alessio Schiavo received the B.Sc. degree in Computer Engineering and the M.Sc. degree in Artificial Intelligence and Data Engineering from the University of Pisa, Pisa, Italy. He is currently pursuing an industrial Ph.D. degree in Computer Engineering focused on Federated Learning, Explainable Artificial Intelligence, and Industrial applications of Artificial Intelligence within the joint research laboratory between the University of Pisa and the LogObject AG company, Ponsacco, Italy.

Title: How I ported Doom to the browser with WebAssembly
Description:
WASM is a powerful platform-agnostic technology. Do you know that you can take advantage of it to port games to the browser as long as the source code can be compiled to WASM? In that regard, I ported DOOM to the Browser thanks to .Net support of WASM._x000D_
_x000D_
I this talk, I will share with you how I managed to develop the port from a pure C# + SAML codebase to a mix of C# + JS. I'll show the process that I followed so that you can reproduce it for any similar game. I'll also share the issues that I encountered along the way and how I solved them._x000D_
_x000D_
The concepts that I'll present can be applied to any language that targets WASM. So, come and live this porting adventure with meüëç.
TagLine: DevRel engineer @ Worldline, teacher and LAUG member
Bio:
Dr. Yassine Benabbas is a DevRel engineer @ Worldline and a teacher. He is a fullstack developer with 20 years of experience, including 10 years of mobile dev (native and cross platform). He is a maintainer of the official technical Blog and YouTube channel of Worldline and he is a member of the Lille Android User Group._x000D_
All his lectures materials are Open Sourced on GitHub and his blog posts are published on Medium, dev.to and blog.worldline.tech.

Title: Superhero Valley: tips and tricks per un futuro in Big Tech
Description:
Se hai mai sognato di lavorare in Big Tech, questo talk √® per te! _x000D_
_x000D_
Abbiamo raccolto consigli pratici e insight esclusivi da dipendenti che hanno vissuto in prima persona il percorso di selezione per entrare in azienda come Google, Meta o Microsoft. Ti forniremo suggerimenti concreti su come prepararsi e affrontare una delle sfide pi√π ambite nel mondo tech._x000D_
_x000D_
Cosa scoprirai:_x000D_
- Quali competenze fanno davvero la differenza. _x000D_
- Cosa avere nel tuo CV per metterti in evidenza durante il processo di selezione._x000D_
- Come affrontare coding interviews e domande comportamentali con sicurezza._x000D_
- Strategie per costruire un profilo professionale in grado di attirare l'attenzione dei recruiter.
TagLine: Community Manager @ Superhero Valley
Bio: Francesco is a Community Manager at Superhero Valley and a student in Artificial Intelligence at the University of Pisa.

Title: üîß‚ú® Dietro le quinte dell‚ÄôAnimazione: il ruolo del Technical Director üé¨üí°
Description:
Guardando un prodotto d‚Äôanimazione, vi siete mai chiesti: ma come fanno a realizzarlo? Dietro ogni produzione in CGI si cela un‚Äôenorme macchina organizzativa, in cui creativit√†, programmazione e problem-solving si intrecciano per dare vita a mondi straordinari._x000D_
_x000D_
Al centro di questo processo c‚Äô√® una figura chiave, spesso poco conosciuta ma essenziale per il successo di ogni progetto: il Technical Director (TD)._x000D_
_x000D_
In questo talk esploreremo il ruolo cruciale del TD nell'animazione moderna, scoprendo le sue responsabilit√†, gli strumenti che utilizza e il suo impatto sulla pipeline di produzione. Analizzeremo le sfide quotidiane, gli strumenti pi√π usati, buttando un occhio sulle tecnologie emergenti che stanno rivoluzionando il settore e, per finire, come intraprendere questa carriera in un‚Äôindustria tanto amata quanto ancora poco conosciuta dal punto di vista professionale._x000D_
_x000D_
Se vi appassionano l‚Äôanimazione, lo sviluppo software o la tecnologia applicata alla creativit√†, questo talk vi offrir√† uno sguardo esclusivo su una delle professioni pi√π dinamiche e richieste nel mondo dell‚Äôentertainment digitale üöÄüé¨
TagLine: Technical Director @ Red Monk Studio
Bio:
Ingegnere Informatico specializzato in Grafica e Multimediaüé¨_x000D_
Ha focalizzato i suoi studi su 3D, Computer Vision e VR, partecipando a progetti entusiasmanti con Unity e Unreal Engineüëæ. La sua esperienza si concentra sulla programmazione in Python, C# e JavaScript ed ha trasformato la sua passione in una carriera dinamica nell'industria delle produzioni 3D. Nel tempo libero ama disegnare, organizzare viaggi alla scoperta di borghi affascinanti e degustare buon vino._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_

_x000D_

Title: What I learned from Five Years of Advent of Code in Kotlin
Description:
For the past five years, Advent of Code has been my December ritual: a month-long challenge of solving programming puzzles. From a funny routine, It slowly became part of my learning journey in discovering all the capabilities of my favorite programming language: Kotlin._x000D_
_x000D_
In this session, I‚Äôll share what is Advent of Code: not just a holiday coding challenge. It‚Äôs the yearly opportunity to challenge yourself and learn new programming tricks. Whether you're preparing for coding interviews or just love solving puzzles, Advent of Code can make a difference on your growth._x000D_
_x000D_
And you might be wondering: why Kotlin? With its concise syntax, powerful standard library, and functional programming features, Kotlin really shines in solving Advent of Code puzzles. In this session, I'll walk you through some real examples, showing how Kotlin makes tackling the Advent of Code easier and enjoyable!
Are you a Google employee or GDE?: Yes, and I will be applying with Google's speaker program
TagLine: Kotlin GDE - Android @ React
Bio:
Nicola Corti is a Google Developer Expert for Kotlin. He has been working with the language since before version 1.0, and he is the maintainer of several open-source libraries and tools for mobile developers._x000D_
_x000D_
He is an active member of the developer community. _x000D_
His involvement goes from speaking at international conferences to being a member of CFP committees and supporting developer communities across Europe._x000D_
_x000D_
In his free time, he also loves podcasting and running.

Title: Make your model think with GRPO (even if you are GPU poor)
Description:
DeepSeek R1, uno dei large language model pi√π discussi del momento, ha introdotto GRPO, un nuovo algoritmo di reinforcement learning che permetterebbe di addestrare modelli che "ragionano". Ma √® davvero cos√¨?_x000D_
Durante questo talk vedremo in cosa consiste l'algoritmo e come √® possibile usarlo per trasformare piccoli LLMs in reasoning models. Inoltre, grazie a Unsloth, potremo replicare questo esperimento con modelli fino a 15B parametri anche non dispondendo di GPU potenti!
TagLine: unknown
Bio: unknown

Title: OTEL: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love My Microservices
Description:
Microservices often get a bad rap for being complex, brittle, and hard to debug. What if the real problem isn‚Äôt the architecture, but the lack of visibility?_x000D_
With proper observability, even the most labyrinthine microservice can be tamed._x000D_
_x000D_
That‚Äôs where OpenTelemetry (OTEL) comes in. By instrumenting tracing, metrics, and logs, it can shed light on the dark corners of your system,_x000D_
turning confusion into clarity. In this talk, we‚Äôll explore how OTEL helps teams regain control, share lessons from real-world deployments, and show how proper observability alleviate the headaches of using microservices._x000D_
_x000D_
If you‚Äôve ever questioned your life choices while debugging a distributed system, this talk is for you. With the right observability strategy, you might just learn to love your microservices!
TagLine: Agile Lab - Big Data Engineer
Bio:
Hi there, I'm Nino! An Italian-Finnish theoretical physicist turned into Big Data for a living. My relentless curiosity drives me to continuously explore new languages and frameworks. _x000D_
Over the past five years, I've thrived in roles ranging from DevOps and Full-Stack to Platform and Big Data Engineering._x000D_
_x000D_
When I'm not diving into data, you can find me challenging gravity with bouldering, centering my mind through yoga, or strategizing my next chess move.

Title: The Courage to Be Different: Rewriting the STEM Narrative
Description: In "The Courage to Be Different: Rewriting the STEM Narrative," Carmen will share her personal journey through the world of STEM, particularly engineering, from the early struggles of challenges, failed exams, and long study days to graduating and conducting research aimed at improving people's lives and changing the world. She will highlight the importance of embracing individuality and challenging conventional ideas and misconceptions about who belongs in STEM. Through her story, she hopes to inspire others to break free from limiting narratives and courageously carve their own path in STEM, proving that diversity of thought and experience is the key to unlocking innovation. By expanding our understanding of who can contribute to STEM, we can reshape the field and become role models for future generations.
TagLine: Research Assistant @BioRobotics Institute (Sant‚ÄôAnna); M.Sc Bionics Engineering and B.Sc Electronics Engineering; STEM advocate and speaker; Miss Universe Italy 2023
Bio: STEM activist, researcher, and communicator. Currently a research assistant @BioRobotics Institute, Sant‚ÄôAnna, she holds a Master‚Äôs in Bionics Engineering and a Bachelor's in Electronics Engineering. She is a speaker and science communicator to challenge STEM stereotypes and bridge the gap between science and society. She teaches STEM courses in schools, as testimonial of law n.187. She is the STEM ambassador for Samsung Italy, and Miss Universe Italy 2023.

Title: AI‚Äôs Hidden Cost: The Environmental Impact of Machine Learning
Description:
The rise of Generative AI has led us to use tools that are slowly changing how we work._x000D_
_x000D_
Training the AI models demands significant resources, including vast amounts of water and energy. In this talk, we‚Äôll uncover the hidden costs of AI on the environment and discuss solutions that have emerged in recent years. _x000D_
_x000D_
Join me in exploring how to make AI more sustainable and discovering how we can reduce its environmental impact while continuing to advance the field.
TagLine: Ph.D. candidate in Computer Science, podcaster and community manager
Bio:
I am a PhD student in Computer Science at the University of Pisa. _x000D_
My research focuses on responsible and trustworthy AI. _x000D_
In my free time, I am a podcaster and a community manager.
